items.description: Information how to contact the point of interest.

^\\w+$.description: Extension point for provider-defined properties from other namespaces

.n2:accountable.description: An individual accountable for the content in legal terms.

.n2:altId.description: An alternative identifier assigned to the content.

.n2:altLoc.description: An alternative location of the content.

.n2:altRep.description: An IRI which, upon dereferencing provides an alternative representation of the Item.

.n2:audience.description: An intended audience for the content.

.n2:bag.description: A group of existing concepts which express a new concept.

items.description: An individual concept, part of a composite concept expressed by a bag.

.n2:broader.description: An identifier of a more generic concept.

.n2:by.description: A natural-language statement about the creator (author, photographer etc.) of the content

.n2:catalogContainer.description: The container of a single catalog

.n2:concept.description: A set of properties defining a concept

.n2:conceptExtProperty.description: Extension Property; the semantics are defined by the concept referenced by the rel attribute. The semantics of the Extension Property must have the same scope as the parent property.

.n2:conceptId.description: The preferred unambiguous identifier for the concept.

.n2:conceptItem.description: An Item containing information about a concept.

.n2:contentCreated.description: The date (and optionally the time) on which the content was created.

.n2:contentMetaExtProperty.description: Extension Property; the semantics are defined by the concept referenced by the rel attribute. The semantics of the Extension Property must have the same scope as the parent property.

.n2:contentModified.description: The date (and optionally the time) on which the content was last modified.

.n2:contentSet.description: A set of alternate renditions of the Item content

items.description: A rendition of the content using plain-text or encoded inline data
A rendition of the content using an XML language

^\\w+$.description: XML elements from any namespace

items.description: A rendition of the content using a reference/link to a resource representing the content data at a remote location

.n2:contributor.description: A party (person or organisation) which modified or enhanced the content, preferably the name of a person.

.n2:copyrightHolder.description: The person or organisation claiming the intellectual property for the content.

.n2:copyrightNotice.description: Any necessary copyright notice for claiming the intellectual property for the content.

.n2:created.description: The date (and optionally the time) on which the resource was created.

.n2:creator.description: A party (person or organisation) which created the resource.

.n2:creditline.description: A free-form expression of the credit(s) for the content

.n2:dateline.description: A natural-language statement of the date and/or place of creation of the content

.n2:definition.description: A natural language definition of the semantics of the concept. This definition is normative only for the scope of the use of this concept.

.n2:deliverableOf.description: A reference to the Planning Item under which this item has been published

.n2:delivery.description: A set of references to G2 items which have been delivered under this news coverage definition.

^\\w+$.description: Extension point for any provider specific properties for news coverage delivery - from any other namespace

items.description: A reference to a G2 item which has been delivered under this news coverage definition.

.n2:derivedFrom.description: Refers to the ids of elements whose values have been derived from the concept represented by this property.

.n2:derivedFromValue.description: Represents the non-Concept value that was used for deriving the value of one or more properties in this NewsML-G2 item.

.n2:description.description: A free-form textual description of the content of the item

.n2:edNote.description: A note addressed to the editorial people receiving the Item.

.n2:embargoed.description: The date and time before which all versions of the Item are embargoed. If absent, the Item is not embargoed.

.n2:event.description: Structured information about an event without a concept identifier, to be used only with News Items

.n2:eventDetails.description: A set of properties with details about an event (Used in the scope of EventsML-G2)

items.description: Indication of the accessibility of the event

n2:dates.description: All dates pertaining to the event, in particular the start and end date and any recurrence information

n2:duration.description: The period the event will last.

items.description: Explicit dates to be excluded from any recurrence.
Rule for dates to be excluded from recurrence.

.n2:inlineRef.description: The concept represented by the content identified by the local identifier(s)

.n2:instanceOf.description: A frequently updating information object that this Item is an instance of.

items.description: A name for a concept assigned as property value.

.n2:origRep.description: An IRI which, upon dereferencing provides the original representation of the Item, the IRI should be persistent.

.n2:packageItem.description: An Item used for packaging references to other Items and Web resources.

.n2:partMeta.description:
A set of properties describing a specific part of the content of the Item. ///
The relationship of properties inside this partMeta and properties at a higher hierarchical level of the content parts structure is:
- the semantic assertion of all properties at a higher level is inherited by this partMeta element as if these properities would be its children
- a child property of a specific name wipes out for this partMeta element any semantic assertions of properties of the same name at higher levels 
- in this latter case: if the semantic assertion of a property at a higher level should be reinstated for this part of the content then this property has to appear again as child of this partMeta

.n2:personDetails.description: A set of properties specific to a person

items.description:
The type of a qualified code, i.e. a scheme alias, followed by a colon (“:”), followed by a code. A string of this type cannot contain white space characters. The code may contain colons.
The Backus Naur Form (BNF) expression for this is:
<qcode> ::= <scheme> ":" <code>
<scheme> is a string containing any character except white space or the ':' character, required <code> is a string containing any character except white space, required

n2:QCodeType.description:
The type of a qualified code, i.e. a scheme alias, followed by a colon (“:”), followed by a code. A string of this type cannot contain white space characters. The code may contain colons.
The Backus Naur Form (BNF) expression for this is:
<qcode> ::= <scheme> ":" <code>
<scheme> is a string containing any character except white space or the ':' character, required <code> is a string containing any character except white space, required
